questions.title: What coding language is this quiz app using to display content?
questions.explanation: This site uses HTML in order to display the content of this page, such as the words you're reading right now and the button below.

questions.title: Which of the following is a class selector?
questions.explanation: To select a element by its class, use a period '.' followed by the name of the class. ex: .myclass

questions.title: Type the html element that makes up the items in each list. ex: <name>
questions.explanation: The <li> element (list item) is the element that makes up a list.

questions.title: Type the html element that allows you to use an external .css file for an html page
questions.explanation: The <link> element allows you to add a external .css file using href='styles.css'

questions.title: Which of these pictures contains a correct way to define a function in Javascript?
questions.explanation: The first image contains the correct way to define a function in Javascript.

questions.title: How do you declare a primary key in SQL?
questions.explanation: The syntax 'PRIMARY KEY (VALUE) is the correct way to declare a primary key.

questions.title: What does the first normal form handle?
questions.correct: It checks if a relation contains a composite or multivalued attribute.
questions.explanation: The first normal form checks if a relation contains a composite or multivalued attribute.
answers: It checks if there are any primary key conflicts in a table
It checks if a relation contains a composite or multivalued attribute.
It checks if there is redundant data in the table
It checks if a relation contains a NULL value

questions.title: Type the clause that is used to specify a requirement in statements. (in all caps)
questions.explanation: The WHERE clause allows the statement to return data with the specified requirements.

questions.title: Which of these pictures contains the correct way to retrieve all the data from a given table
questions.explanation: The third image contains the correct way to format the statement.

questions.title: Which of these tables has a sensible primary key?
questions.explanation: The employee id would be unique to each employee. People can share last names, departments, and even passwords with one another.
